data.title: Packard to buy online photo firm Snapfish
data.meta_description: SAN FRANCISCO (AFX) - Hewlett-Packard Co said that it will buy Internet photo firm Snapfish to expand its photo and imaging technology reach to the market for online picture storage and printing services.

'); //--> Infoimaging

Hewlett-Packard to buy online photo firm Snapfish

,

AFX News Limited

SAN FRANCISCO (AFX) - Hewlett-Packard Co said that it will buy Internet photo firm Snapfish to expand its photo and imaging technology reach to the market for online picture storage and printing services.

The purchase price was not disclosed.

H-P, with its No. 1 position among printers, has introduced several digital cameras and specialized inks as part of its efforts to become an all-in-one hardware and services provider for digital camera users. Snapfish, based in San Francisco, claims more than 13 mln registered members, many of whom store prints in photo albums that can be viewed through the company's Web site.

Snapfish President Ben Nelson will lead the new division within H-P. Terms of the deal weren't disclosed

Snapfish charges 2.99 usd to develop a roll of film, and sells individual prints starting at 19 cents each.

Nelson, and Larry Lesley, H-P's senior vice president of consumer imaging and printing, said the deal pushes both companies forward in their efforts in the online photo market.

"It's a natural extension of our photo strategy," Lesley said. "The digital photo market is about self-expression, and we think we have the products to get people to want to be creative with their digital photos."

The deal puts H-P up against Eastman Kodak and its Ofoto service, which will change its name to Kodak EasyShare later this spring.

H-P said it expects the deal to close in April.
